Package cp213

Class SingleLink<T>

java.lang.Object
cp213.SingleLink<T>
Type Parameters:
T - data type for structure.
All Implemented Interfaces:
Iterable<T>
Direct Known Subclasses:
SingleList, SinglePriorityQueue, SingleQueue, SingleStack
public abstract class SingleLink<T> extends Object implements Iterable<T>
The abstract base class for singly-linked data structures. Provides attributes and implementations for getLength, peek, isEmpty, append, moveFrontToRear, moveFrontToFront, and iterator methods.
Version:
2022-05-12
Author:
your name, id, email here

  • Constructor Details

    • SingleLink

      public SingleLink()

  • Method Details

    • append

      protected void append(SingleLink<T> source)
      Protected helper method to append the entire source to the rear of this. source becomes empty. All front, rear, and length attributes are appropriately updated in both SingleLink objects. O(1) operation - must not use loops. source must contain at least one node, or the method throws an AssertionError.
      Parameters:
      source - the nodes to append to the end of this.

    • moveFrontToFront

      protected void moveFrontToFront(SingleLink<T> source)
      Protected helper method to move the front node of source to the front of this. All front, rear, and length attributes are appropriately updated in both SingleLink objects. O(1) operation - must not use loops. source must contain at least one node, or the method throws an AssertionError.
      Parameters:
      source - The SingleLink to extract the front node from.

    • moveFrontToRear

      protected void moveFrontToRear(SingleLink<T> source)
      Protected helper method to move the front node of source to the rear of this. All front, rear, and length attributes are appropriately updated in both SingleLink objects. O(1) operation - must not use loops. source must contain at least one node, or the method throws an AssertionError.
      Parameters:
      source - The SingleLink to extract the front node from.

    • getLength

      public final int getLength()
      Returns the current number of values in the linked structure.
      Returns:
      the value of length.

    • isEmpty

      public final boolean isEmpty()
      Determines whether the linked data structure is empty or not.
      Returns:
      true if data structure is empty, false otherwise.

    • iterator

      public final Iterator<T> iterator()
      Specified by:
      iterator in interface Iterable<T>

    • peek

      public final T peek()
      Returns a reference to the first value of the linked structure without removing that value from the structure.
      Returns:
      The value in the front of the structure.
